H0.text: What is the name for the pieces of wood that sit on top of cricket wickets. Crossbar

H1.text: What is the name for the pieces of wood that sit on top of cricket wickets. Wicketcap

H2.text: What is the name for the pieces of wood that sit on top of cricket wickets. Stumpstop

H3.text: What is the name for the pieces of wood that sit on top of cricket wickets. Bail

A4.text: In the sport of cricket, a bail is one of the two smaller sticks placed on top of the three stumps to form a wicket.

A5.text: The bails are used to determine when the wicket is broken or put down, which in turn is one of the critical factors in determining whether a batter is out bowled, stumped, run out or hit wicket.
